title: Employment Contracts - Labor Code and Civil Code Provisions
coverage: Employment relationships, wages, benefits, termination, working conditions

required_clauses.name: position
required_clauses.description: Job title and nature of work
required_clauses.requirement: Nature of work must be specified

required_clauses.name: salary
required_clauses.requirement: Must meet or exceed minimum wage

required_clauses.name: work_schedule
required_clauses.requirement: At least 24 consecutive hours rest per week
required_clauses.default: Monday to Saturday, rest on Sunday

salary.description: Minimum wage in NCR (2024) - varies by region
salary.article: Labor Code Article 124, RTWPB Wage Orders

leave_entitlements.name: Service Incentive Leave (SIL)
leave_entitlements.description: Paid leave after 1 year of service

leave_entitlements.name: Maternity Leave
leave_entitlements.description: For female employees (105 days, 120 for solo parents)
leave_entitlements.conditions: Normal delivery: 105 days; Cesarean: +15 days; Solo parent: +15 days

leave_entitlements.name: VAWC Leave
leave_entitlements.description: For victims of violence against women and children

just_causes: Gross and habitual neglect of duties
Fraud or willful breach of trust
Other causes analogous to the foregoing
authorized_causes: Closure or cessation of business operation
Disease (if continued employment prohibited by law or prejudicial to health)

notice_requirements.authorized_cause_notice: 30 days written notice to employee and DOLE

separation_pay.redundancy: 1 month pay per year of service
separation_pay.retrenchment: 1 month pay or 1/2 month per year (whichever higher)
separation_pay.closure: 1 month pay per year of service
separation_pay.disease: 1 month pay or 1/2 month per year (whichever higher)

probationary_termination.rule: May be terminated for failure to qualify
probationary_termination.notice: Reasonable standards must be made known

working_time_provisions.compressed_workweek: May exceed 8 hours if not exceeding 48 hours/week

special_protections.name: Security of Tenure
special_protections.description: Regular employees cannot be dismissed without just/authorized cause

special_protections.name: Non-Diminution of Benefits
special_protections.description: Benefits cannot be reduced once granted

special_protections.name: No Involuntary Servitude
special_protections.description: No contract amounting to involuntary servitude is valid

special_protections.name: Payment in Legal Currency
special_protections.description: Wages must be paid in Philippine pesos
special_protections.article: Civil Code Article 1705, Labor Code Article 102

special_protections.name: Anti-Discrimination
special_protections.description: Protection against discrimination (age, sex, religion, etc.)

special_protections.name: Data Privacy
special_protections.description: Employee personal data must be protected

special_protections.name: Anti-Sexual Harassment
special_protections.description: Workplace must be free from sexual harassment

special_protections.name: Safe Spaces Act
special_protections.law: RA 11313 (Safe Spaces Act / Bawal Bastos Law)

household_service_rules.compensation: Must be reasonably compensated (free service is void)
household_service_rules.lodging_food: Free suitable quarters, adequate food, medical attendance
household_service_rules.humane_treatment: Just and humane treatment, no physical violence

working_hours_check.description: Normal working hours should not exceed 8 hours/day

rest_day_check.description: At least 24 consecutive hours rest per week

benefits_check.description: SSS, PhilHealth, Pag-IBIG, 13th month pay are mandatory

prohibited_stipulations.no_involuntary_servitude: Any contract amounting to involuntary servitude is VOID
prohibited_stipulations.no_wage_withholding: Cannot withhold wages except for debt due
prohibited_stipulations.no_free_household_service: Household service without compensation is VOID

supplemental_laws.coverage: Minimum wage fixing, regional wage boards, wage orders
supplemental_laws.administered_by: Regional Tripartite Wages and Productivity Boards (RTWPBs)
supplemental_laws.notes: Supplements Labor Code Article 124 on minimum wage fixing
Applies to hiring, promotion, training, compensation, and termination

minimum_wage_setting.rule: Minimum wages shall be fixed by Regional Tripartite Wage Boards

regional_variation.rule: Minimum wage may vary by region, industry, or sector

wage_order_effectivity.rule: Wage orders take effect after publication

exemptions.rule: RTWPBs may grant exemptions to distressed establishments

wage_distortion.rule: Employers must correct wage distortions caused by wage orders

prohibited_acts.rule: Declining employment application due to age
Discriminating in compensation, benefits, or promotion based on age
Forcing early retirement due to age
Publishing job ads with age limits (unless bona fide occupational qualification)

lawful_exceptions.rule: Age limitation allowed only if it is a bona fide occupational qualification

wage_compliance.rule: Employer must comply with applicable regional minimum wage orders

non_discrimination.rule: Employer must ensure equal opportunity regardless of age

wage_violation_penalty.rule: Non-compliance with wage orders subject to fines and penalties

age_discrimination_penalty.rule: Age discrimination punishable by fine and/or imprisonment

regional_wage_order_check.description: Verify salary complies with applicable regional wage order

age_discrimination_check.description: Ensure no employment term discriminates based on age
